TopicTitle: [1.11.x] AmpYear Main & Reserve Power Manager (v1.5.9.0) 22nd Feb 2021

Articles.Content:
Ampyear 1.5.6 released for KSP 1.8.x

Will try to do all my other mods this weekend as well.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, JPLRepo said:
> 
> 
> Ampyear 1.5.6 released for KSP 1.8.x
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Will try to do all my other mods this weekend as well.
> 

Thanks for this.  I was going to ask you when you were present in someone's Twitch stream the other day (Rocketology's, perhaps) but I thought I'd just wait.
The AmpYear settings screen at the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> is busted and KSPedia pages are busted. Working on fixing it.

Hello,

I don't see anyone mentioning a similar problem.

I got the latest 1.5.6.0 of AmpYear on KSP 1.8

The mod seems to be working fine, I can see the menu in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>, it's responsive and updating.

But I can't seem to find the<u> reserve batteries</u> anywhere.

ampYear\_Z1K\_ReserveBatteryBank

ampYear\_Z100\_ReserveBatteryPack

ampYear\_Z400\_ReserveBatteryPack

These part files and folders are in GameData, but they're not showing up in the game.

Also interestingly, the "Janitor's Closet" filtering mod doesn't seem to list AmpYear, so I can't filter by it.

I tried to filter by "Reserve Power" option, but the batteries still not showing up.

I would be happy if you could help me figure out what's wrong.

If you are interested, I can send you my log files, just tell me how and from where would you like to receive them.

Thank you so much in advance.

> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, Problemless Mods Wanter said:
> 
> 
> If you are interested, I can send you my log files, just tell me how and from where would you like to receive them.
> 

See the link in my sig block on how to report problems/issues.  You should post log as a link to a file sharing service such as Dropbox, Google Drive, One Drive, etc.  Never post full logs directly to the forums; the moderators will remove log posted this way because it makes it difficult for people on mobile devices.

**Edited <time datetime="2019-10-28T18:19:47Z" title="10/28/2019 06:19  PM" data-short="4 yr">October 28, 2019</time> by Brigadier**
Can I use this mod without the parts and just get the Reserve Power on probe cores?

Hello,

I believe the curved solar panels from **Near Future** have lost their compatibility again.

The parts which are not calculated, that I can find are;

**NIV-30 Curved Solar Array** and **NIV-45 Curved Solar Array**.

I haven't tested all parts from Near Future but other parts seems to be calculated.

Thank you so much in advance for your concern and have a wonderful day...

UPDATE:

I'm also noticing that the PB-NUK Radioisotope Thermoelectric Generator is not calculated. =(

**Edited <time datetime="2019-12-14T05:00:48Z" title="12/14/2019 05:00  AM" data-short="4 yr">December 14, 2019</time> by Problemless Mods Wanter**
  
About PB-NUK Radioisotope Thermoelectric Generator

I'm getting a strange issue with AmpYear in KSP 1.7.3, running <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> / RP-1 along with TAC-LS and <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-MKS: 

The KSP loading sequence gets stuck when it tries to compile the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-MKS Tundra PDU part. KSP doesn't crash or even become unresponsive. The loading screen continues to turn over, but it doesn't progress. No warnings, errors, or exceptions are thrown in the KSP log. Removing AmpYear allows the game to load normally. 

Thoughts? Suggestions?

EDIT: SOLUTION FOUND

It turned out to be an issue with the AmpyYear <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> config file. The definition for integration with <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> is incorrect. Why this causes it to choke on this particular part? I have no idea. However, the fix is simple because you change one line:

    @RESOURCE

should be

    @RESOURCE[ReservePower]

Happy to submit an issue on github or just upload my fixed version if you'd like.

Suggest updating to the latest version of KSP and the mod. I only support the latest version.

So, KSP 1.9 is out !!

Hello, I'm having an issue with your recent update (at least I think it is Ampyear. Had trouble triangulating which mod in your folder is causing the issue).

The red exit button along with the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> and <abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr> no longer work. the back button seems to try and bring me to X1 Warp. Attaching a log file.

If you need anything else, lmk. I had a lot of mods installed (100+) but the log file is only of the test with just reposoft folder +<abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr>. 

Thankyou for all the hard work!

[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hzfoj7xVsr-0k0vROBqV08CLG-sZQndK/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hzfoj7xVsr-0k0vROBqV08CLG-sZQndK/view?usp=sharing)

yeah, ill give you a third strike against me. After reinstalling it, it seems to work fine. I think <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> must have installed the update wrong.

I'm asking for trouble, but the other mods "work" and I've tried the process of reverting all my mods and game back to 1.8.1 and I spend hours figuring out what's broken. good luck on future updates!

Took forever to find this, thanks [@Omnipius](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/173022-omnipius/)

Ok The reply of "I suggest updating to the current version of KSP".... seems abit "deaf" to your issue, that being <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>/RP1 in <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>.

I had the issue too and AmpYear is a "essential mod" for all "Realistic Progression 1 career's" in <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>/<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>.

**Could you please send a message to the RP1 guys**, namely [@siimav](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/178033-siimav/) as he seems to update the "how to install" pages, so we can all see your fix?

To mod author/maintainer.... could you please update a single line in a single <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> file for the <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>/<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>/RP1 communities? I know its a pain but we are always a version or so of KSP behind due to the massive dependencies for a correct "mod-pack" set-up... **Please & thank you**
